results.title: Looking Back
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.
results.description: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.
description_for_label: Three locals talk about personal histories in the small town of Caramut in regional Victoria. Take a trip down memory lane with Patricia Giles as she talks about soldier settlement and how the town has changed over the years. Tom and Dan Dickson look back on their family history and give us a tour of the town, including a stone bridge their great grandfather built that still stands in Caramut today.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.

results.title: Tell me a story (Canberra) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: This compilation of eleven stories, created by Canberra locals, was the culmination of ACMI’s ‘Train the trainer’ workshops. The stories, mostly biographical, cover a wide range of topics but are mostly concerned with beloved family members and life changing events.

results.title: Minh: a Vietnamese
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia. Minh talks about his life and hopes for his children in his new country.

results.title: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Discussion highlights a young Yugoslav girl’s desire to become Australian in order to gain acceptance and combat prejudice. By contrast, her Australian friend endorses the continuance of ethnic identity and customs and extols the virtues of a multicultural society.
results.title_for_label: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Discussion highlights a young Yugoslav girl’s desire to become Australian in order to gain acceptance and combat prejudice. By contrast, her Australian friend endorses the continuance of ethnic identity and customs and extols the virtues of a multicultural society.
description_for_label:

results.title: Sue and Mario: the Italian Australians
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
An introduction to the hybrid lifestyles resulting from the marriage of two second-generation Australians of different ethnic origins. Both Sue and Mario are second generation Australians. Sue’s family migrated from England, whilst Mario’s came from Italy. The couple live in Griffith, a N.S.W. rural community where more than fifty per cent of the population is of Italian descent. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.description:
